intro: Onosma popoviana, commonly known as the Afghan blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its stems are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs.
